resources.string: The height of the female elephant is 7 feet (2.1 meters) and the male is 10 feet (3 meters). It can weigh up to 6 tons, its length reaches 4.5 meters and its tusks are 2 meters long
" The most prominent feature of Amebelodon is the lower tusk that is shaped like a spade. These two tusks are flat, flat and close together"

The woolly mammoth was last seen 4,000 years ago on a remote island in the Arctic Ocean. Humans have indeed lived side by side with mammoths. Unfortunately, early humans used to hunt mammoths to use their organs. For example, wearing fur as clothing or ivory as a tool for hunting.
Usually elephant tusks are curved upwards, in contrast to Deinotherium. This elephant tusk actually curves downwards and tends to be short.
Menurut para ilmuwan, Palaeomastodon adalah kerabat dekat Moeritherium, salah satu nenek moyang gajah. Sepintas, wujudnya mirip dengan tapir yang kita kenal sekarang.
Stegomastodon elephants lived in the Late Pliocene to Modern, about 3 million to 10,000 years ago
" Andalgalornis is a giant predatory bird that lived during the Late Miocene, or about 23 million years ago."
Titanis became one of the birds that was quite feared during the Pliocene to Pleistocene, or about 3.1 million years ago and earned the nickname as the Terror Bird.
The animal, which has the Latin name Phorusracos longissimus, which means very long, has a height of 2.5 meters and a weight of 130 kg.

30 million years ago. Birds with the Latin name Gastornis gigantea generally preyed on small mammals that lived at that time. The height of which reached 2 meters made this bird the main predator at that time.
" Argentavis is the largest flying bird that has ever existed on earth, with a wingspan of 7 meters to 8 meters."
Kelenken became the largest flightless bird, from the Phorusrhacidae family that ever existed, with a skull length that has been found to be 71.6 cm.
Lancetfish measure about 2 meters and can be found in many oceans except the poles. He also preys on smaller fish, squid and even his own.
The magnificence of this beautifully colored animal can be seen up to two meters above the air to catch birds or bats
This deep-sea predator that existed in the Cretaceous period is still alive today.
The population of this fish is highly threatened due to uncontrolled hunting. This species can grow up to 6 meters. Sturgeons are also harmless to humans unless they feel threatened.

Also known as the saw shark. This marine predator also has a near-extinct status. In addition to the sea, Sawfish can also be found in rivers or creeks. Its size reaches 7 meters making it look like a shark.
This pet food is small fish and even small sharks. This fish is also commonly found in dark waters.
